_header: Man sigh and sorrow for thy sins
_description: An exhortation to penance and shrift — twenty-six lines (using two rhymes only)

BodAddB66.First Lines:
Man sigh & sorw for þi synnesþan semeþ þi
                    synnes as slaynMan in schrifte schewe al þi synnesþan lyn
                    þei ful dede for certeyn …
BodAddB66.Last Lines:
…And bringe us to þi blis þat neuer blynnesAll
                    myghti god lord & souereyne
BodAddB66.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 229-30.
